snippet: The sudden surge in violence between Indians and Pakistanis is a troubling development in Kashmir, where a cease-fire has been in place for almost 10 years.
abstract: India claims that Pakistanis killed two Indian soldiers during eruption of gunfire in disputed territory of Kashmir, second exchange of fire in two days.

byline.contributor: Ismail Khan contributed reporting from Peshawar, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The sudden surge in violence between Indians and Pakistanis is a troubling development in Kashmir, where a cease-fire has been in place for almost 10 years.

headline.seo: In Clashes in Kashmir, Indians Claim 2 Soldiers Were Killed
headline.main: Two Soldiers Die in Clashes in Kashmir, India Says
headline.print_headline: Two Soldiers Die in Clashes In Kashmir, India Says
